13:25 if you wonder why LAN 2 didn't broadcast the mess in second attempt is because:   See when in the first attempt,   the message is sent to all the nodes by the switch, the router also received it. Since it is the correct recipient, it forwards the packet to the destination switch. The destination switch broadcasts it to all devices in LAN 2, to create it's own mac address table.   Then in the second attempt , the exchange succeeds.

How to configure two networks using packet tracer 1.	There must be at least two networks 2.	Networks are also directly connected with each other 3.	Each network must have 4 Layer 2 Links (Switches). 4.	At least 10 PC’s and 10 IP Phones in Each network.
